meanings.definition: To fall, sink, or collapse suddenly
meanings.sent1: The cat flops onto the soft bed.
meanings.sent2: She flops down on the grass after a long run.
meanings.sent3: The balloon flops to the ground after losing air.
meanings.sent4: The tired tree branch flops under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: The kite flops in the wind, unable to stay up.

meanings.sent1: The movie was a total flops at the box office.
meanings.sent2: His plan to start a business turned out to be a flops.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party was a flops with no cake or games.
meanings.sent4: The science experiment was a flops, causing a mess in the lab.
meanings.sent5: The play was a flops, with actors forgetting their lines.

meanings.definition: The sound made by something falling or hitting a surface
meanings.sent1: The loud flops of the books hitting the floor startled her.
meanings.sent2: The gentle flops of the raindrops on the roof helped her sleep.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected flops of the apples rolling off the table made her laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic flops of the basketball echoed in the empty gym.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive flops of the hammer on the nail filled the room.
